channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israeli president’s office denies Trump’s claim Netanyahu pardon is ‘on its way’
item.description: Isaac Herzog’s spokesperson says he has not spoken to Trump since US president wrote to urge him to stop trial The office of Israel’s president, Isaac...

item.title: Ukraine war live: Russia says it has moved its nuclear-capable Oreshnik missiles into Belarus
item.description: Move could feasibly allow Russian missiles to reach European targets faster from Belarus, its neighbouring ally that also shares a border with Nato co...

item.title: Cecilia Giménez, famed for ‘Monkey Christ’ mural mishap, dies at 94
item.description: Spanish woman’s attempted restoration of church artwork was widely mocked but became lucrative tourist attraction Cecilia Giménez, the woman who achie...

item.title: US judge halts ending of temporary protected status for South Sudanese migrants
item.description: Emergency request by several of the country’s nationals and an immigrants rights group was granted by the court A federal judge on Tuesday blocked pla...

item.title: Offenders in England and Wales to have alcohol levels tracked over new year period
item.description: Sobriety tags worn by thousands released from prison or serving community sentences will monitor wearers’ sweat Thousands of offenders in England and ...

item.title: Saudi Arabia backs call for UAE to leave Yemen after strike on separatist-held port
item.description: The UAE denies Saudi claims it sent a shipment of weapons to separatists and pushed them to launch offensives against the Yemeni government.

item.title: Flight to edge of space left me harassed and depressed
item.description: Blue Origin's all-female crew, which included scientist Amanda Nguyen, was launched into space in April.

item.title: Why has Littler been booed at World Championship?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why world number one Luke Littler has been booed at the PDC World Darts Championship.

item.title: Labour criticises Tory shadow minister for representing Abramovich
item.description: Labour says it is "indefensible" for Lord Wolfson to keep his role while acting as a lawyer for the Russian billionaire.

item.title: Snow, ice and colder weather to bring in the new year with warnings issued
item.description: It is set to turn much colder across the UK for the start of the new year with warnings issued for cold weather, snow and ice.
